result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry R. Swanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
DNA Proof of Submission

Case called: 1:41 p.m. 
Clerk: Heather.      
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears w/Atty Peter Prusinski;

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to;
CT 1 (Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm)>>AMEND to: Disorderly Conduct 947.01.
CT 2 (Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm)>>AMEND to: Disorderly Conduct 947.01.
COURT grants above;
PLEA: 
CT 1 (Disorderly Conduct)>>NO CONTEST.
CT 2 (Disorderly Conduct)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
CT 1: $50.00 fine plus CC and DNA surcharge; DNA sample; 60 days to pay or make payment arrangements.
CT 2: CC plus DNA surcharge; DNA sample; 60 days to pay or make payment arrangements. 

Adjourned: 1:47 p.m.
Plea hearing on July 25, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
ADA Barnett appears; Atty Prusinski appears; Parties have agreement - Programs/Assessment to be completed prior to plea.
